title: Anisus spirorbis
text:
Anisus spirorbis is a <a href="species">species</a> of small freshwater air-breathing <a href="snail">snail</a>, an <a href="Aquatic%20animal">aquatic</a> <a href="pulmonate">pulmonate</a> <a href="gastropod">gastropod</a> <a href="mollusk">mollusk</a> in the family <a href="Planorbidae">Planorbidae</a>, the <a href="sheep">ram</a>'s horn snails. 
Taxonomy.
"Anisus spirorbis" may be a broad-whorled morphotype of "<a href="Anisus%20leucostoma">Anisus leucostoma</a>".
Distribution.
Europe to Siberia.
This species occurs in countries that include:
Description.
The <a href="gastropod%20shell">shell</a> is 1 to 1.5 mm high and measures 4 to 5.5 mm in diameter. It has approximately 4.5 <a href="whorl%20%28mollusc%29">whorls</a>. The mouth is oblique to the axis of the coil. The whorls are increase relatively rapidly (in relation to other "Anisus" species). The shell is yellowish horn coloured and bears thin growth strips. The body of the animal is grey-brownish black with lighter colored tentacles.
